metadata.Title: CVE-2019-7629 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the strip_vt102_codes function in TinTin++2.01.6 and WinTin++ 2.01.6 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrarycode by sending a long message to the client.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7629` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tintin++ - 2.01.5-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tintin++ package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.01.5-2').
